image.altText: a green MFS truck parks outside the Grote St entrance of the Adelaide Central Markets

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Central Market will be closed for the rest of the day after the state's MFS said a significant amount of smoke went through the complex after a fire broke out in the market car park.

title.children: Popular Adelaide Central Markets closes on key trading day after fire breaks out in car park

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt hands over a package to a man in a blue shirt wearing a battered and dirty wide-brimmed hat outside.

props.synopsis: Bruce Ross had moved to the green pastures and rolling hills of South Australia's wine country after running a remote pub on the Oodnadatta Track. But when a rare postie job became available, the open skies and red dirt of the outback called to him once again.

title.children: Publican-turned-postie a lifeline for outback stations and stranded tourists

image.altText: a picture of behind someone driving a car with a phone using maps

props.synopsis: An overhaul of SA's taxi and ridesharing sector includes proposals to compensate drivers whose licences lost value when Uber arrived, boost regional services, and improve reliability for passengers with disabilities — but the reforms will be paid for by passengers.

title.children: Taxi licence buybacks on offer as SA looks to boost regional ridesharing — but fares set to rise

image.altText: Police officers and detectives standing on a street.

props.synopsis: The 65-year-old victim of an alleged manslaughter in Adelaide's north died after becoming a "third party" to a "disturbance" between two other people, police have said.

title.children: Alleged manslaughter victim died after intervening in street 'altercation', SA police say

image.altText: A man in a black shirt leans over a rail and looks out into the distance. He is standing on a boat docked in the river.

props.synopsis: The State Emergency Service has responded to a number of marine rescue call-outs on the River Murray in the last fortnight.

title.children: Houseboats getting stuck in River Murray threaten multi-million-dollar tourism industry

image.altText: An Adelaide ambulance.

props.synopsis: A senior Royal Adelaide Hospital doctor has been prevented from giving evidence about ambulance ramping to an inquest investigating the deaths of three patients, with the inquiry hearing SA Health had "refused" to allow her to speak on the subject.

title.children: Doctor blocked from giving ambulance ramping evidence after SA Health 'refused', inquest told

image.altText: Police at the scene of a crash at Port Lincoln.

props.synopsis: The 23-month-old girl was struck by the car along the seaside city's main shopping strip late on Thursday afternoon, and has been taken to Adelaide's Women's and Children's Hospital.

title.children: Toddler taken to hospital in critical condition after being hit by car at Port Lincoln

image.altText: Port Adelaide's Dan Houston makes a handpass

props.synopsis: Dan Houston has shut down persistent links with a move back to his home state of Victoria, saying he will remain at Port Adelaide in 2025.

title.children: 'I absolutely love the footy club': Dan Houston set to remain at Port Adelaide despite rampant trade rumours

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears a stern expression on his face as he sits in the House of Reps

props.synopsis: The prime minister says his government has not changed its policy on questions for the next census, despite being forced to clean up a messy debate over how the nation's LGBTQI+ community will be counted in the next survey.

title.children: Albanese insists Labor has not changed stance on LGBTQI+ questions in census

image.altText: Amanda Reid celebrates winning Paralympic gold.

props.synopsis: Amanda Reid wins back-to-back gold medals in the women's C1-3 500m time trial, while Australia celebrates podium finishes in the para athletics after stunning performances from Michael Roeger and Madison de Rozario. Follow live.

title.children: Australia's Amanda Reid claims Paralympic gold in Paris, Roeger and de Rozario add to medal tally

image.altText: Trump Cheng collage

props.synopsis: The Hong Kong billionaires who saved Donald Trump from bankruptcy have finally achieved what he could not: a piece of the Australian casino business.

title.children: 'Dangerous' Australian casino connections saved Donald Trump from ruin

image.altText: A man surrounded by media cameramen

props.synopsis: Doctor Mark Chavez has agreed to turn over his medical licence and enter a guilty plea in the case involving the fatal drug overdose of Friends star Matthew Perry.

title.children: Doctor charged in connection with Matthew Perry's death set to plead guilty

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin holds his fist above his head in celebration

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin claims the biggest win of his career, defeating Novak Djokovic in four sets at the US Open to move into the fourth round of a grand slam for the first time.

title.children: Alexei Popyrin downs Novak Djokovic as young Aussie soars to new heights at US Open

image.altText: A group of dead fish in the water.

props.synopsis: More than 100 tonnes of dead fish have collected in and around the port of Volos in central Greece after a mass die-off linked to extreme weather fluctuations.

title.children: Dead fish fill Greek waterways after extreme weather causes mass die-off

image.altText: Liam Gallagher leans with an arm slung over his brother Noel's shoulder.

props.synopsis: Oasis has issued a warning against resellers after some tickets were listed for thousands of pounds minutes after pre-sale.

title.children: Oasis issues warning after reunion tour tickets relisted for more than $11,000

image.altText: A man in suit with a Taiwan flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Ko Wen-je, a former mayor of Taipei and opposition party leader, has been arrested as part of a graft investigation involving a major property development in the Taiwanese capital.

title.children: Taipei's former mayor Ko Wen-je arrested in graft probe

image.altText: The cuple in white and pick in a portrait embrace

props.synopsis: Learn all of the controversies surrounding the newest Norwegian royal couple, before they tie the knot this weekend.

title.children: A Norwegian princess and a shaman to the stars will marry this weekend. Here's why their nuptials have angered local media

image.altText: Christian Petracca of the Melbourne Demons running with the AFL ball, looking over his right shoulder for a teammate

props.synopsis: Melbourne superstar Christian Petracca reveals he will stay at the Demons after weeks of rumblings about his AFL future.

title.children: Petracca commits to future with Melbourne after weeks of trade speculation

image.altText: A composite image shows headshots of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump

props.synopsis: As the energy around Kamala Harris's nomination settles and she emerges from her first real test, the strategy behind Republican attack ads becomes clear, writes Jade Macmillan.

title.children: As Kamala Harris emerges from a major interview, the Republican plan against her crystallises

image.altText: wintery day in tasmania as snow and dark clouds mover across a mountain

props.synopsis: The extreme weather variability observed across Australia in late August will become even more pronounced through the first days of spring.

title.children: Polar blast and snow to replace record winter heat as infamous spring seesaw arrives

image.altText: A composite image featuring photos of Peter Dutton, Anthony Albanese and Adam Bandt.

props.synopsis: The Greens and the Coalition seemingly have the government stuck in a game of piggy in the middle, desperately trying to catch the ball as it is thrown between its two major political opponents.

title.children: The government is stuck playing games that have little to do with running the country

image.altText: Missy Higgins

props.synopsis: After two decades in the music industry, singer-songwriter Missy Higgins says she's never felt more vulnerable.

title.children: Missy Higgins on the moment her life 'burned to the ground'

image.altText: Photo illustration of Anna Marie Gewargis, another covering her face and childrens blocks to the right

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has revealed how a 31-year-old woman swindled parents, investors and even her landlord in an illegal childcare scheme across Sydney.

title.children: 'She's a master manipulator': The illegal childcare centre that left an investor and parents $275k out of pocket

image.altText: LGBT flag

props.synopsis: The government's pair of about-faces on the census has left residual frustration in its ranks.

title.children: Inside Labor's census wobble: How the government made an issue by trying to unmake it

image.altText: A young white boy running through a field after a young white girl

props.synopsis: There are two important questions confronting any parents with young kids: are you giving them autonomy and have you equipped them with the competence to be truly and safely independent?

title.children: A mum being reported to social services for letting her teen travel Europe is a sad sign of today's risk-averse parenting

image.altText: Two men in suits layered on a composite image of a youth prison

props.synopsis: The tragedy of WA's first recorded death in juvenile detention last year sparked a damning coronial inquest that showed how broken the system that locked up teenagers was. Yet 10 months later, here we are again.

title.children: There may be few votes in youth justice reform, but yet another child dead shows the time is now

image.altText: Fireball burning from a Greek oil tanker in the Red Sea.

props.synopsis: The ship, which was attacked by Houthi rebels in the Red Sea, has been on fire for a week as officials try to recover the tanker and avoid an environmental disaster.

title.children: A burning tanker could be about to drop a million barrels of oil into the Red Sea

image.altText: A blind woman sitting on the arm of a couch looking out the window.

props.synopsis: People with disability have long felt discriminated against when travelling by air. After the release of the long-awaited Aviation White Paper, could things be about to change?

title.children: When Emma's at the airport, she often feels 'like a piece of luggage' instead of a human being

image.altText: Kharkiv bomb attack

props.synopsis: Ukrainian authorities say five aerial guided bombs were used in the bomb attack, which targeted a high-rise building in a residential area of Kharkiv.

title.children: Russian bomb attack on Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv kills seven, including 14yo girl

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: Brazil has started blocking Elon Musk's social media platform X, making it largely inaccessible there on both the web and through mobile apps, following the billionaire's refusal to identify a legal representative in the country.

title.children: Brazil begins blocking Elon Musk's social media platform X

image.altText: A rocky desert landscape.

props.synopsis: A fossilised tooth from the world's largest predator has been "chiselled" from a site on WA's World Heritage-listed Ningaloo Coast, angering scientists as well as the conservationist and writer.

title.children: 'Insta-bogans' endangering precious Ningaloo Coast, author Tim Winton says

image.altText: A man in a suit smiles at the camera, while standing next to a vacant block of land.

props.synopsis: Götene has a population problem, and in a bid to attract new residents, it's almost giving away blocks of land. The "wild plan" has gone viral online, and the town mayor hopes it could put the forgotten town back on the map.

title.children: This Scandi town is selling land for the price of a coffee, but is it too good to be true?

image.altText: Shopping receipt printed on thermal paper

props.synopsis: If sharp increases in interest rates aren't the right tool to control inflation, what is? The experience of the 1980s provides an idea.

title.children: There is a paradox at the heart of the cost-of-living debate

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiles with a man behind her

props.synopsis: The stakes for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz were high as they sat down with CNN for their first interview since Joe Biden stepped aside. These were the biggest moments.

title.children: It's no secret Kamala Harris hates interviews. These were the big moments from her sit-down with CNN
